data.title: License type is definitely not Apache.
data.body: Not sure if there's a package.json specific identifier to use, there's nothing listed in teh SPDX license identifier list (because those are all open licenses)

data.body: Based on http://discuss.atom.io/t/apm-test-and-js-specs/1579/3

data.title: Atom command doesnâ€™t pass environment variables to Atom
data.body:
Reported in the forum http://discuss.atom.io/t/atom-command-doesnt-pass-environment-variables-to-atom/1596

They recommend prepending `open` with `env`. But I'm not sure if that will cause other side effects.

data.title: Elixir grammar throws errors
data.body:
Install from https://github.com/lucasmazza/language-elixir

Below is the console output from typing `d`:

```
Popping rule because it loops at column 0 of line 'd' 
Array[1]
0: Rule
anchorPosition: -1
createEndPattern: null
endPattern: undefined
grammar: Grammar
patterns: Array[50]
registry: Syntax
scannersByBaseGrammarName: Object
scopeName: "source.elixir"
__proto__: Rule
length: 1
__proto__: Array[0]
 /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/first-mate/lib/grammar.js:117
module.exports.Grammar.tokenizeLine /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/first-mate/lib/grammar.js:117
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getNextTokens' of undefined /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/history.js:99
```

data.title: Allow the gutter to show relative line numbers
data.body: https://github.com/atom/vim-mode/issues/54#issuecomment-36278523

data.title: Theme doc update
data.body: I want the naming conventions to be clear for themes, so this.

data.title: Improve reporting of display buffer errors
data.body: Previously, lots of situation-specific information was being baked into the error message, which is also used as the grouping mechanism for errors on bugsnag. This PR adds a custom error class for translation errors and pushes situation specific information into a metadata field which is now sent to Bugsnag by [exception-reporting 0.16.0](https://github.com/atom/exception-reporting/releases/tag/v0.16.0).

data.title: Define additional variables in syntax-variables.less
data.body:
@benogle and I think `syntax-variables.less` we should define:
- cursor-color
- selection-color
- text-color
- background-color

So that plugins can choose appropriate colors that will have the proper contrast and avoid the white on white problem as seen in atom/solarized-light-syntax#2 (and various other tickets).

Every syntax theme will need to override them so we'll need to update the docs as well explaining this.

data.title: Source map support for stylesheets
data.body: I was looking through the history #1448 looks like coffeescript got sourcemap support. I would love to see support for sourcemap stylesheets.

data.title: Bump max size to 2MB
data.body: 336 people have tried to open a file larger than 1MB 1345 times, let's bump it to 2MB and see what happens.

data.title: No more character by character undo
data.body:
https://twitter.com/gnb/status/439155269432774657

Use a debouncer or something. SImilar to the way `content-edited` event works.

data.title: Pull the docs folder into a public repo
data.body: It would be nice if the public could help us improve the docs. Putting them into a public repo and the using a submodule in atom/atom should still keep everything building correctly.

data.title: Can't dismiss inspector after crash and reload
data.body:
Friend couldn't figure out how to dismiss the inspector at the bottom after an error and cmd-shift-p => Reload. We did a screensharing session and I couldn't figure it out either.

![image 2-27-14 at 4 25 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/623/2288149/92823008-9ff6-11e3-8881-fd51367d74e0.jpg)

data.title: Reopen windows when relaunching Atom
data.body:
A feature I love about ST2 and iA Writer, which I'm missing in Atom, is when you quit the app with open windows (including unsaved documents), they all appear again when you reopen. 

This has saved me countless times in my workflow to handle having to do a system restart for software update, etc and not have to take time to save all my unsaved docs, etc. 

It's also nice because I generally have five or six open projects that I just keep minimized in the editor for ease of access. It would be great to have such a feature in Atom.

data.title: open new file on double click in tab blank space
data.body:
One of the features of the ST2 interface that I miss is being able to double click the blank area of a nav bar beside the tab to get a new file.

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1319791/2287621/20e63108-9fef-11e3-8ffe-6152601d5290.png)

data.title: display file location on tab hover AND context click
data.body:
I love that you can view a file's location when hovering on the tab, but waiting for things to appear on hover is not the strong suit of most devs I know. :smile:

Seems context click (two finger, right click, etc) is not being used for anything on tabs currently, what do you think about adding support for displaying that info on both hover AND context click?

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1319791/2287616/15a257b8-9fef-11e3-85df-4c9ea60c100e.png)

data.title: Allow more than one new unsaved buffer at a time.
data.body:
http://discuss.atom.io/t/why-can-i-only-have-one-new-file-at-a-time/447

This seems like a pretty reasonable request.

data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell@0.10.2
data.body: Fixed some crashes.

data.title: Add LSMinimumSystemVersion to prevent opening on 10.7
data.body: http://discuss.atom.io/t/nuclear-fusion-on-my-mac/196/5

data.title: Slow expanding directories with a ton of entries
data.body:
1. Expand a directory with a ton of entries (~600).
2. Wait a few seconds while the editor blocks for it to expand.

data.title: Expanding directory with many items hangs editor
data.body:
1. Expanded a directory that has a ton of entries (~600 items).
2. Clicked on an image.
3. Tried to click on another image.
4. Window locked up.
5. Got the "Editor not responding" error sheet.

I took a sample of the app while it was spinning but I'm not sure if it'd be helpful to you. It's mostly just `<unknown binary>` in `libchromiumcontent`.

data.title: `atom` requires the app be at /Applications/Atom.app
data.body:
The `atom` command line tool seems to assume that Atom's at `/Applications/Atom.app`:

```
lilBrudder:Mac joshaber$ atom
Atom application not found at '/Applications/Atom.app'
```

That's less than ideal.

data.title: User could not publish package that is in a GitHub repo
data.body:
Not sure why this isn't working.

```
Blake Mizerany:
    how do I publish a theme. I already have one made.
    ?
    just found http://atom.io/docs/v0.59.0/publishing-a-package
Corey Johnson:
    did that doc answer your question?
Blake Mizerany:
    kinda
    getting
    Package must pushed up to GitHub before publishing: https://help.github.com/articles/create-a-repo
    but it is pushed
Corey Johnson:
    we need a better error message
    is it a public or private repo?
Blake Mizerany:
    https://github.com/bmizerany/fsh
    oh. wait
    nah. didn't work
    this is right? https://github.com/bmizerany/fsh/blob/master/package.json
Corey Johnson:
    Ha, i love this package
    That looks right
    and you ran `apm publish minor`
Blake Mizerany:
    $ apm publish
Package must pushed up to GitHub before publishing: https://help.github.com/articles/create-a-repo
$ apm publish major
Package must pushed up to GitHub before publishing: https://help.github.com/articles/create-a-repo
$ apm publish minor
Package must pushed up to GitHub before publishing: https://help.github.com/articles/create-a-repo
```

data.title: Can't search for packages on .56
data.body:
## Steps to reproduce
1. Open up the packages settings pane
2. Search for a package that's not installed (i have none installed right now), tried both slug and a word in the name, e.g. `spell` and `spell-checker`
## Expected

Find the package that's listed on atom.io
## Actual

No results found
## Troubleshooting

Tried nuking my `.atom` directory with no such luck. @tjl2 mentioned in chat being able to reproduce the same results after upgrading from 0.55.

data.title: Beta day
data.body:
### DEFCON 2
- [x] Verify invites on staging
- [x] Verify that packages moved out of the atom org can be published to (e.g. probablycorey/visual-bell)
- [x] Republish packages that have been moved from atom org. to personal accounts
- [x] Invite 5 non-github test user
### DEFCON 1
- [x] Merge github/atom.io#279
- [x] Tweet the atom.io website from @atomeditor
- [x] Publish initial blog post
### Post Beta
- [x] Add discourse link to contact page and welcome package
- [ ] Don't popup devtools when there is an error
- [ ] Figure out why the cli tools keep popping up errors
